intro: Telipogon storkii subsp. magnificus, commonly known as the magnificent stork's bill, is a rare and striking member of the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers and slender, branched stems. Native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes, this subspecies thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
